page.title: 06CHURCHES
page.content: Saint Joseph's Church,Whitnash. In 1957 there was an old R.A.F.hut instead of a church.On Sundays a priest from the town-centre (Leamington St. Peter's church) came to say Mass; there was just one Mass a week. In 1963 Father Joseph McKenna then a curate in Walsall was informed that he was to be the new Parish Priest of Whitnash and Bishops Tachbrook. He decided his first priority was to build a new church.A simple plan was drawn up (a circular design).No frills were allowed.There was no stained glass and the church was to hold 400 people.A few years after it was built a stained glass window was commissioned of Oliver Plunkett who was the last person to be hung ,drawn and quartered.The background is green, as well as showing the face of the
